description: Function: Provides energy for ABC-2 transport system-mediated substrate import/export using ATP hydrolysis; Role in LAB: Supports nutrient uptake and metabolite export, facilitating growth and metabolic activity in lactic acid bacteria; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances LAB survival and performance during fermentation, contributing to consistent probiotic function and food quality; Biological Pathway: Involved in ABC transporter systems (EC:3.6.3.12, EC:3.6.3.21), linking ATP hydrolysis to substrate transport across membranes in LAB

Function: Hydrolyzes sucrose-6-phosphate to release free sucrose and inorganic phosphate; Role in LAB: Supports carbohydrate metabolism by enabling utilization of sucrose for energy production; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Contributes indirectly to sugar metabolism and fermentation efficiency in LAB-based foods; Biological Pathway: Starch and sucrose metabolism (EC:3.1.3.24, map00500, map01110).

Function: Forms membrane channel component of the ABC-2 type transport system, facilitating substrate translocation across the cell membrane; Role in LAB: Aids in nutrient import and waste export, maintaining cellular homeostasis; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances survival under stress by supporting efficient transport processes; Biological Pathway: ABC transporter systems (map02010), associated with membrane transport mechanisms.

Function: Provides energy for ABC transport system–mediated substrate import/export using ATP hydrolysis; Role in LAB: Supports nutrient uptake and metabolite export; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances LAB survival and transport efficiency during fermentation; Biological Pathway: Involved in ABC transporter systems (map02010).

Function: Hydrolyzes 6-phospho-?-glucosides to release glucose-6-phosphate; Role in LAB: Enables utilization of phosphorylated sugars for energy metabolism; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports carbohydrate metabolism and growth during fermentation; Biological Pathway: Glycolysis/Gluconeogenesis and Starch and sucrose metabolism (EC:3.2.1.86, map00010, map00500).

Function: Acts as a redox-sensitive transcriptional regulator controlling stress response genes; Role in LAB: Helps manage oxidative and disulfide stress; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Promotes cell survival under oxidative and environmental stress; Biological Pathway: Part of redox regulation and stress response networks.

Function: Forms membrane channel component of ABC transport system for substrate translocation; Role in LAB: Facilitates import of nutrients and export of metabolites; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Maintains metabolic balance under fermentation conditions; Biological Pathway: ABC transporter systems (map02010).

Function: Provides energy for substrate translocation via ABC transporter using ATP hydrolysis; Role in LAB: Ensures efficient nutrient and metabolite transport; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Improves nutrient acquisition during fermentation; Biological Pathway: ABC transporter systems (map02010).

Function: Acts as an RNA chaperone stabilizing RNA and proteins during cold stress; Role in LAB: Facilitates adaptation and survival under low-temperature conditions; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances cold tolerance in starter cultures; Biological Pathway: Cold shock response regulation.

Function: Converts pyruvate to L-lactate using NADH, regenerating NAD? for glycolysis; Role in LAB: Central enzyme in lactic acid fermentation, maintaining redox balance; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Essential for acid production, flavor development, and preservation in fermented foods; Biological Pathway: Glycolysis/Gluconeogenesis, Pyruvate metabolism (EC:1.1.1.27, map00010, map00620).

Function: Transports  and phosphorylates cellobiose via the phosphotransferase system (PTS); Role in LAB: Enables uptake and metabolism of disaccharides; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports carbohydrate utilization and fermentation efficiency; Biological Pathway: Starch and sucrose metabolism; Phosphotransferase system (map00500, map02060).

Function: Binds D-methionine for delivery to its ABC transport system; Role in LAB: Facilitates amino acid uptake for protein and cofactor synthesis; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports nutritional adaptation and growth in nutrient-variable environments; Biological Pathway: ABC transporters (map02010).

Function: Facilitates passive transport of glycerol across the cell membrane; Role in LAB: Provides carbon and energy sources under fermentative conditions; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances flexibility in substrate utilization; Biological Pathway: Glycerol transport and carbon source uptake.

Function: Binds polar amino acids for translocation via ABC transporters; Role in LAB: Enables efficient amino acid acquisition; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports growth and metabolic versatility in food environments; Biological Pathway: ABC transporter systems (map02010).

Function: Represses transcription of the galactose operon, regulating sugar metabolism; Role in LAB: Controls carbohydrate utilization pathways; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Balances sugar metabolism to optimize fermentation; Biological Pathway: Galactose metabolism regulation.

Function: Catalyzes ATP formation from carbamoyl phosphate and ADP; Role in LAB: Links nitrogen and energy metabolism; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Contributes to energy generation under anaerobic conditions; Biological Pathway: Arginine and nitrogen metabolism (EC:2.7.2.2, map00220, map00910).

Function: Synthesizes heptaprenyl diphosphate, a precursor for menaquinone (vitamin K?) and other terpenoids; Role in LAB: Supports quinone biosynthesis for electron transport; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances redox balance and antioxidant capacity; Biological Pathway: Terpenoid backbone biosynthesis (EC:2.5.1.30, map00900).

Function: Reduces 3-oxoacyl-ACP intermediates in fatty acid synthesis; Role in LAB: Participates in membrane lipid biosynthesis; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Maintains cell membrane integrity during stress; Biological Pathway: Fatty acid biosynthesis (EC:1.1.1.100, map00061).

Function: Catalyzes conversion of FGAR to FGAM in purine biosynthesis; Role in LAB: Essential for nucleotide and DNA/RNA synthesis; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports cell growth and replication; Biological Pathway: Purine metabolism (EC:6.3.5.3, map00230).

Function: Structural component of the 50S large ribosomal subunit (protein L33); Role in LAB: Contributes to ribosome assembly and stability for protein synthesis; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports efficient translation and growth during fermentation; Biological Pathway: Ribosome (map03010).

Function: Imports magnesium ions across the membrane; Role in LAB: Maintains intracellular Mg²? levels required for enzymatic activity and ribosome stability; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances metabolic enzyme activity and stress tolerance; Biological Pathway: Magnesium ion transport.

Function: Catalyzes DNA transposition events; Role in LAB: Facilitates genome rearrangement and genetic adaptability; Probiotic/Food Relevance: May contribute to genomic evolution and adaptation in probiotic strains; Biological Pathway: Transposition and mobile genetic element activity.

Function: Hydrolyzes phosphorylated substrates as part of HAD superfamily hydrolases; Role in LAB: Participates in dephosphorylation reactions in metabolism; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports diverse metabolic functions; Biological Pathway: General metabolism and phosphatase activity.

Function: Catalyzes DNA transposition enabling gene mobility; Role in LAB: Promotes horizontal gene transfer and genetic diversity; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances adaptability under environmental stress; Biological Pathway: Transposition and genome mobility.

Function: Cleaves CAAX motifs from prenylated proteins during maturation; Role in LAB: Involved in post-translational modification of membrane-associated proteins; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Aids protein processing and cellular function; Biological Pathway: Protein maturation and processing.

Function: Converts specific uridines to pseudouridines in 23S rRNA, enhancing ribosome stability and function; Role in LAB: Maintains translational accuracy and ribosomal integrity; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports robust protein synthesis and cell viability; Biological Pathway: RNA modification.

Function: Catalyzes acetylation of maltose to form maltose O-acetate; Role in LAB: Regulates carbohydrate metabolism and detoxifies acetyl-CoA derivatives; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Contributes to carbohydrate processing and stress protection; Biological Pathway: Carbohydrate metabolism.

Function: Provides ATP-derived energy for polar amino acid transport via ABC-type transporter; Role in LAB: Enables uptake of essential amino acids; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports protein biosynthesis and metabolic balance; Biological Pathway: ABC transporters.

Function: Binds oligopeptides for transport through the ABC transporter system; Role in LAB: Facilitates peptide uptake for nutrition and signaling; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Involved in quorum sensing and nutrient acquisition; Biological Pathway: ABC transporters, quorum sensing (map01501, map02010, map02024).

Function: Catalyzes conversion of 3-phosphoglycerate to 2-phosphoglycerate in glycolysis; Role in LAB: Essential for energy metabolism and amino acid biosynthesis; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports lactic acid production and growth; Biological Pathway: Glycolysis/Gluconeogenesis and amino acid metabolism (EC:5.4.2.11, map00010, map00260).
